name: Philosophy and ethics
description: Falling under Humanities (except languages), this field involves the study of fundamental questions about existence, knowledge, values, reason, mind, and language, as well as moral principles. [cite: 97]

name: Ethics
description: A branch of philosophy that involves systematizing, defending, and recommending concepts of right and wrong conduct, a core component of Philosophy and ethics. [cite: 97]

name: Logic
description: The study of reasoning and valid inference, a fundamental area within Philosophy and ethics. [cite: 97]

name: Morals
description: The study of principles concerning the distinction between right and wrong or good and bad behaviour, closely related to ethics within Philosophy and ethics. [cite: 97]

name: Philosophy
description: The systematic study of general and fundamental questions concerning existence, knowledge, values, reason, mind, and language, the central discipline in Philosophy and ethics. [cite: 97]
